sentences.en: ...Queen Victoria's reign.
sentences.cn: …维多利亚女王的统治时期。

sentences.en: And the steamboats, though their reign was longer, were ephemeral craft.
sentences.cn: 汽船的时代虽然比较长些, 还是一种朝不保夕的工具.

sentences.en: Archaeologists have dated the fort to the reign of Emperor Antoninus Pius.
sentences.cn: 考古学家判定这个堡垒建于罗马皇帝安东尼·庇护统治时期。

sentences.en: As the reign of Elizabeth proceeded the religious atmosphere heightened.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎白的统治年复一年,宗教紧张气氛与日俱增.

sentences.en: Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.
sentences.cn: 宁为鸡口,毋为牛后.

sentences.en: changes that took place during Charlemagne’s reign
sentences.cn: 查理曼大帝统治时期的变革

sentences.en: during his reign at the Education Department
sentences.cn: 在他担任教育部领导期间

sentences.en: For several minutes confusion reigned .
sentences.cn: 有好几分钟场面大乱。

sentences.en: George VI reigned from 1936 to 1952.
sentences.cn: 乔治六世于1936年至1952年在位。

sentences.en: He asks if Banquo's issue shall reign in Scotland.
sentences.cn: 他怀疑班柯的后嗣会君临苏格兰.

sentences.en: Her reign lapped over into the seventeenth century.
sentences.cn: 她的统治延至17世纪.

sentences.en: It was during the reign of Queen Isabella that Christopher Columbus set forth on his epic voyage of discovery.
sentences.cn: 正是在伊莎贝拉女王统治时期克里斯托弗·哥伦布开始了他伟大的发现之旅。

sentences.en: Its descendants will reign over it forever, whether gifted or boobies.
sentences.cn: 它子子孙孙, 不论贤愚,都永远身居王位.

sentences.en: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.cn: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

sentences.en: Neither side would have an incentive to start a war. Ergo, peace would reign.
sentences.cn: 双方都不会有开战的动机，所以将会是和平时期。

sentences.en: Night resumes her reign.
sentences.cn: 夜幕又降临了.

sentences.en: She would appear on the porch and reign over the street in magisterial beauty.
sentences.cn: 她会出现在阳台上,以她雍容之美成为注目的焦点.

sentences.en: Silence reigned while we waited for news.
sentences.cn: 我们在等待消息的时候鸦雀无声。

sentences.en: The gallant soldiers lost their lives so that peace might reign again.
sentences.cn: 英勇的战士们为恢复和平献出了生命。

sentences.en: The reign of Kertarajasa was peaceful and the whole land obedient.
sentences.cn: 格尔达拉查沙的统治是太平的,全国是忠顺的.

sentences.en: The reign of Queen Elizabeth lapped over into the seventeenth century.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎白王朝延至17世纪.

sentences.en: The steamboats, though their reign was longer, were ephemeral craft.
sentences.cn: 汽船的时代虽然比较长, 仍是一种难保长久的水上工具.

words.tran_cn: 统治的；在位的；本届的；起支配作用的

trans.tran_cn: 君主的统治，君主统治时期，任期，当政期
trans.tran_en: the period when someone is king, queen, or emperor
if a feeling or quality reigns, it exists strongly for a period of time
the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor
If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused
the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

trans.tran_cn: 想法、情感或氛围盛行，成为最显著的
